page.title: 05Religion.-Sutton Church.
page.content: There has been a church in Sutton since the 12th century.Early in the 15th century the west tower was built.It is built of stone with a slate roof. There is a legend about a tunnel in the East Wall.We think it leads to the Old Rectory cellars.It is now blocked up because it caved in half way.The oldest part of the church is the massive arch in the North wall.It was built about 1080.On one of the walls there is a kind of boiler house with stairs leading down to it.It has a flat roof.The church has a grave yard. The church is called Saint Michael and all Angels. The Rev.L.S.Rivett is the present Rector.There is at least one service every Sunday at this church.There is a Sunday School for the children of the three villages of Sutton,Elvington and East Cottingwith.
